title: Go-To Pizza Dough

ingredients.content: 1 oz olive oil, plus extra to grease

preparations.content: Lightly grease a large bowl and set aside.
Place bread flour, whole wheat flour, water, sugar, yeast, 1 oz olive oil and salt into mixing bowl and knead <b>2 min/<b>.
Form dough into a ball and transfer into prepared bowl. Cover with cling wrap and let dough rise until doubled in size (approx. 1 hr.). Use dough as required by recipe.

hintsAndTricks: To test for proofing: place a small ball of dough in a glass of water and when it rises to the top the dough has finished proofing.

To shape pizza, divide dough into two pieces and place dough on prepared pizza pans or a baking sheets lined with parchment paper. Press it out with your fingertips from the center to the edges, and gently stretch it into shape. Let rest 5 minutes. Add favorite sauce and toppings and bake 10-15 minutes (450°F) until crispy and golden.

Pizza stone method: follow manufacturer's instructions for use. Preheat pizza stone for 20 minutes 450°F. Transfer dough to a silicone mat or a lightly floured surface and divide into two pieces. Shape both pieces of dough into a rough circle by gently stretching dough with your fingers. Carefully slide one pizza base onto the stone using a pizza peel and cook as per recipe. Repeat with remaining dough.
Add 1 tsp of Italian herbs to crust when adding salt to the recipe.

Replace rapid rise yeast with active dry yeast version: use all ingredients in recipe replacing the rapid rise yeast for 1 tsp of active dry yeast. Place water, yeast and sugar into mixing bowl and heat <b>2 min/110°F/speed 2<b>. Add flours, oil and salt and knead <b>2 min<b>. Continue with recipe allowing bread dough to rise for 4 hours not the regular 40 minutes.
